Draggable (type in module ui.drop )

Description

Draggable state is an object containing the drag state of a particular DOM node. It is instantiated and attached via draggable().

The Draggable object is attached to a DOM node via jqLite / jQuery's expandostore, using the key $draggable. However, it is recomended that querying for a node's Draggable state be done using draggable() or isDraggable(), in case the expandostore key is changed in the future.

This object provides several helpers which may be used in custom draggable node directives in order to customize the behaviour of drag & drop.

Methods

  • drag(event)

    drag is used to continue a mouse drag, and is typically called in response to a mousemove event.

    Like dragStart(), there are several properties which are expected to be present in the event object. event.pageX and event.pageY are used to determine the relative position from the last mouse position, and must be present in the event.

    This method functions simply by adding the difference in mouse coordinates between the last cached position with the current absolute position of the element, and sets the new position as an absolute position to the element's style.

    Parameters

    • event – {MouseEvent} –

      The event to which dragEnd is responding

  • dragEnd(event)

    dragEnd is used to terminate a mouse drag. This is typically called in response to a mouseup event on the document.

    This method essentially delegates functionality to the $drag provider in order to find the appropriate droppable element (if any) to drop over, and attempt to place the element.

    Like dragStart(), there are several properties which are expected to be present in the event object. $drop.drop() makes use of event.clientX and event.clientY if they are available, which they should be in a mouse event.

    Parameters

    • event – {MouseEvent} –

      The event to which dragEnd is responding

  • dragStart(event)

    dragStart is meant to be called in response to a mouse event such as mousedown. This routine is bound to the element's mousedown event during the construction of the Draggable state.

    If it is desirable to simulate an event, the only properties which are actually used in the event are Event.pageX and Event.pageY, which respectfully represent the position relative to the left edge of the document, and the position relative to the top edge of the document.

    See event.pageX and event.pageY for more details.

    Parameters

    • event – {MouseEvent} –

      The event to which dragStart is responding

  • finish()

    The finish method is a simple helper, called by Droppable.drop() in order to terminate the dragging interaction.

    This method simply restores the original css position property to its original pre-drag value, and clears the currentDrag value.

    This should be considered a private method for the time being, because it is likely to be removed from Draggable in the near future.
